highlights.title: Full editor experience
highlights.description: Sandpack uses CodeMirror under the hood, giving you all the basic capabilities of a code editor and syntax highlight. However, if you want to use your own editor framework, you can add that as a component too!

highlights.title: Advanced preview
highlights.description: Sandpack embeds the browser bundler that powers CodeSandbox and takes advantage of features like npm dependency support, hot module reloading, error overlaying, and caching.

highlights.title: Leverage CodeSandbox
highlights.description: With Sandpack, you're always one click away from opening your code snippet in CodeSandbox. This way, you can easily share bug reports or examples behind a unique URL.

examples.title: Providers & Custom Hooks
examples.description: SandpackProvider is available to manage the state and actions and ThemeProvider handles the theme and style. A set of hooks gives you access to the state and offers an API for integrating custom components into Sandpack.

examples.title: Sandpack Components
examples.description: The <Sandpack /> component is made up of smaller parts that you can import separately to combine with your custom components.

examples.title: Sandpack Client
examples.description: The bundler is wrapped by a small package called sandpack-client, which is framework agnostic and allowing you to tap into the bundler protocol.

highlights.title: React docs
highlights.description: Want to try out a solution right on the same page alongside the guides or examples? With Sandpack you can embed a playground right into your documentation.

highlights.title: Sound Demo
highlights.description: How about using sound to build an atmospheric editor experience? For instance, try coding an epic feature to the backing score of a fantasy adventure or fix bugs in a meditative zen with atmospheric music.

highlights.title: Multiple Previews
highlights.description: For generative art or responsive design, Sandpack can render multiple previews to help you see all the variations you need.

highlights.title: Interactive blog post by Varun Vachhar
highlights.description: Sandpack is also well suited for blog posts. Provide inline code examples for readers while keeping your blog's code easy to maintain.
